sentences.en: Being stingy or making some excuse about not paying doesn't seem to be gentlemanly.
sentences.cn: 而且,表示小气或是找借口谢绝买单看起来好像不那么绅士.

sentences.en: Englishmen were regarded as the most gentlemanly people in the world.
sentences.cn: 世界上最有绅士风度的人.

sentences.en: He looked very smart , very gentlemanly, and all that.
He was respected by all who knew him for his kind and gentlemanly consideration.
sentences.cn: 他为人谦和而且有绅士风度，认识他的人都很尊重他。

sentences.en: Rich and gentlemanly, what does he care?
sentences.cn: 又有钱,又有气派, 他还用牵挂什么 呢 ?

sentences.en: The law, being a profession, was accounted a more gentlemanly pursuit than business.
sentences.cn: 把法律当作职业, 比做生意要高尚一些.

sentences.en: The leather jacket in the latest fashion shows more clearly gentlemanly demeanor.
sentences.cn: 新潮新派的皮茄克,更显男士风度.

sentences.en: This hairstyle of the latest fashion highlights the Best gentlemanly demeanor.
sentences.cn: 这种发型,新潮新派;男士风度,尽在其中.

sentences.en: Zhu and Yx clap. Liang bows gentlemanly to F , Yingtai, Yinxin and the audience.
sentences.cn: 祝英台和银心齐鼓掌. 梁山伯向祝老爷 、 祝英台 、 银心还有观众鞠躬.

trans.tran_cn: 彬彬有礼的，绅士风度的，绅士派头的
trans.tran_en: a man who is gentlemanly speaks and behaves politely, and treats other people with respect
